results.prompt_sent: I'm starting work on a dark mode feature for our app. Set up everything I need to track this work: create a project for it, then create a workunit inside that project for the implementation work. The workunit should have a clear problem statement and success criteria that you derive from the feature context.

arguments.name: Dark Mode Feature
arguments.description: Implementing dark mode support for the application with user preference settings and system theme integration

arguments.name: Dark Mode Implementation
arguments.problem_statement: Users experience eye strain in low-light conditions and prefer dark interface options; current light mode causes discomfort during nighttime use
arguments.success_criteria: Successfully implement system-wide dark mode with automatic theme switching, 90% reduction in reported eye strain cases, and user preference persistence across sessions
arguments.description: Develop and integrate dark mode implementation with theme switching capabilities

results.task_name: Break down a feature into tasks
results.prompt_sent: I need to implement user notifications for workunit updates. Think about what steps are actually needed to build this end-to-end, then create a workunit called "Implement User Notifications" and add all the implementation tasks to it. Be thorough — this is a real feature, not a toy example.

arguments.name: Implement User Notifications
arguments.problem_statement: Users require real-time notifications for critical workunit updates to ensure timely action and collaboration.
arguments.success_criteria: Notifications are delivered instantly via email/web push, include actionable details, support user preferences, and log in audit trails.
arguments.description: Develop end-to-end notification system for workunits including triggers, delivery mechanisms, and compliance features

arguments.title: Define notification requirements and scope
arguments.description: Collaborate with stakeholders to document all notification scenarios, channels, and user preferences

arguments.title: Design notification architecture
arguments.description: Create system diagram for notification triggers, delivery pipelines, and integration points

arguments.title: Implement backend notification engine
arguments.description: Develop API endpoints and message queuing system for workunit notifications

arguments.title: Build frontend notification UI
arguments.description: Create dashboard components for users to manage notification preferences and view history

arguments.title: Integrate with communication channels
arguments.description: Connect to email, SMS, and push notification services (e.g., Firebase, SendGrid)

arguments.title: Implement user preference management
arguments.description: Develop settings for notification channels, frequency, and scope customization

arguments.title: Add audit logging
arguments.description: Track all notifications sent with timestamps, recipients, and content hashes

arguments.title: Write automated tests
arguments.description: Create unit/integration tests for all notification scenarios and edge cases

arguments.title: Conduct security review
arguments.description: Validate encryption, access controls, and data privacy compliance

arguments.name: Implement User Notifications
arguments.description: End-to-end notification system with triggers, delivery, preferences, and compliance

results.prompt_sent: Search for any workunits related to authentication in our workspace. For each one you find that is still active or in draft, add an insight noting what you observed about its current state during the quarterly audit review.

We just decided to use WebSockets instead of polling for our real-time notification feature. This is important context for the team. Find the notifications workunit and save this as a critical architectural decision, explaining the tradeoffs we considered.

arguments.title: Real-time Notification Implementation
arguments.content: Chose WebSockets over polling for real-time notifications considering latency, server load, and scalability tradeoffs.

results.task_name: Create a project with linked asset
results.prompt_sent: Set up a new project called "API v2" for our REST API redesign work. This project will be tracked in our GitHub repo at github.com/example/api-v2 on the main branch. Also create a knowledge asset called "API v2 Design Spec" and link it to the project — it's a document describing the new API design.

arguments.name: API v2 Design Spec
arguments.description: Document describing the new API design

results.prompt_sent: Look at the tasks in the "Implement User Notifications" workunit. Any task that mentions 'test' or 'testing' should be set to normal priority. Any task that mentions 'bug' or 'fix' should be set to high priority. Apply these rules now.

It's the end of the sprint. For the "Implement User Notifications" workunit: mark all todo tasks as done, save a progress context atom summarizing what was accomplished, and then mark the workunit itself as completed with a summary note.
